intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. olivaceofasciculatus, commonly known as the olive-streaked kidney bean, is a variant of the common bean species. It is characterized by its distinctive olive-green streaks on the pod and seeds. The plant is an annual legume that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. It produces small, hairy leaves and bears clusters of white or pale pink flowers. This variety is valued for its unique appearance and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes or as a specialty crop.
